SEARCH
Package ca.openosp.openo.rx.erx.model

Class ERxFacilityPreferences

java.lang.Object
ca.openosp.openo.rx.erx.model.ERxFacilityPreferences
public class ERxFacilityPreferences extends Object
Provides an abstract way to reference the the External Prescriber preferences specific to a clinic/facility. These are usually used during batch operations.

FUTURE: org.oscarehr.rx.erx should, in the future, support more than one external prescription service , which may not necessarily need the same facility preference object as the External Prescriber. When this support is added, this class should be renamed to org.oscarehr.rx.erx.model.FacilityPreferences; which should implement a new interface named org.oscarehr.rx.erx.model.ERxFacilityPreferences. This new interface should define getters/setters for an authentication structure (in this case username, password, facilityId and clientNumber), and a service URL (and org.oscarehr.rx.erx.model.FacilityPreferences should be re-factored as such.

  • Constructor Details

    • ERxFacilityPreferences

      protected ERxFacilityPreferences()

    • ERxFacilityPreferences

      public ERxFacilityPreferences(int facilityId, URL remoteURL, String username, String password, String clientNumber, boolean isTraining, String locale)
      Create an instance of a ERxFacilityPreferences object.
      Parameters:
      facilityId - The unique facility identifier corresponding to this facility, provided by the External Prescriber.
      remoteURL - The URL of the www service to connect to, provided by the External Prescriber.
      username - The facility's username, which will be used to connect to the www service and is provided by the External Prescriber.
      password - The facility's password, which will be used to connect to the www service and is provided by the External Prescriber.
      clientNumber - The unique clinic number corresponding to this facility, provided by the External Prescriber.
      isTraining - Whether or not the facility is in training mode.
      locale - The locale (language) that the facility uses.

    • getNextTransactionId

      public static long getNextTransactionId()
      Get a unique transaction ID. According to the XSD/SOAP specification, an integer is a signed number between (-2^32) and 2^31-1.

      Note: There's a possibility that the External Prescriber will choke on this after Tue, 19 January 2038 at 03:14:07 UTC.

      Note: Java will choke on this after Sun, 04 December 292,277,026,596 at 15:30:08 UTC.

      Returns:
      A unique transaction ID between 0 and 2147483647.
